business.headline: Explained: Why India shouldn't lose sleep over Trump's 25% tariffsIndia shouldn't trade its future for short-term calm. Trump's tariff move is more noise than policy. Staying firm now will protect India's strength and choices in the long run.

May consider dividends to citizens: Trump on tariff revenue disbursal plansTrump has signed a new executive order that imposes fresh import tariffs on goods from 69 countries and the European Union, which will come into effect on August 7.

Loan fraud case: ED issues lookout notice against Anil AmbaniA lookout circular has been issued against Anil Ambani at the request of the Enforcement Directorate (ED), preventing him from travelling abroad without court permission.

Anil Ambani faces lookout notice in Rs 3,000-crore loan fraud caseAnil Ambani can now no longer travel outside India without court permission. This comes after a series of crackdowns on his business entities, allegations of fraud against his firms, and a summons issued by a federal agency.
Vandana Vasudevan on how tech is reshaping daily lifeSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan explains how this shift is changing daily routines.

OTP Please! The double-edged sword of digital living: Vandana VasudevanSpeaking with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, OTP Please author Vandana Vasudevan tells how tech has changed how we live, making travel easier for the disabled, food more accessible, and work more flexible. But she warns of fading community bonds, unhealthy habits, and insecure gig jobs. Tech must support life, not replace human connection.

US tariffs will not have significant adverse impact on Indian economy: SourcesThe 25% tariff announced by US President Donald Trump will not have a significant adverse impact on the Indian economy, government sources said.

Elon Musk's Starlink to operate soon in India. Check monthly plansUnion Telecom Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia confirmed that Starlink has been awarded a Unified Licence to launch its satellite internet operations in India.
Sensex closes 586 points lower, Nifty below 25,600; Infosys ends 3% downThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 585.67 points to close at 80,599.91, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 203 points to end at 24,565.35.

CA explains why you should not use FDs as an emergency fundAccording to RBI guidelines, banks can charge up to 0.5% to 1.0% of the interest rate as a penalty if FDs are broken before their maturity period.

Indian interests top priority, no chance of compromising due to US tariffs: SourcesAn official said that the government is closely watching the developments but sees no reason for alarm after the US imposed a 25% tariff on India.

Jane Street not cooperating in probe with income tax department: ReportThe firm's servers are located outside India, and officials said they are unable to access them. Additionally, accounts books are also being maintained overseas, even though company law requires them to be kept in India.

entertainment.headline: Rajinikanth roasts Coolie director, his self-deprecating jokes win hearts at eventSuperstar Rajinikanth is known for his public speaking skills. At the 'Coolie' audio launch, he made everyone laugh out loud while appreciating and complimenting the cast and crew of the film.

Veteran Tamil actor and comedian Madhan Bob dies at 71 after cancer battleMadhan Bob, renowned Tamil actor and comedian, died at 71 in Chennai. He was undergoing cancer treatment for the past few years.

Gauri Khan, Suhana celebrate SRK, Rani and Karan Johar's National Award winShah Rukh Khan won his first National Award for his performance in 'Jawan'. His wife, Gauri Khan and daughter Suhana celebrated SRK, Rani Mukerji and Karan Johar's win at the 71st National Film Awards.

Film body warns Kartik Aaryan over event by Pakistani restaurant, actor denies linkActor Kartik Aaryan's team has clarified that he is not associated with the event organised by a Pakistani-owned restaurant. The response came after Federation of Western lndia Cine Employees (FWICE) warned him against the same.

Kollywood's 1st Rs 1,000 crore loading: Internet on Rajinikanth's Coolie trailerThe trailer of director Lokesh Kanagaraj's 'Coolie' has been released amid much anticipation. Social media users have predicted that the Rajinikanth-starrer could be Kollywood's first Rs 1,000 crore film. The film, featuring an ensemble cast, is set to release on August 14.

Coolie audio launch: Crowd erupts as Rajinikanth enters venue, Aamir Khan hugs himSuperstar Rajinikanth received a rousing welcome at the Nehru Indoor Stadium in Chennai on Saturday. He greeted the cast and crew and hugged them as he welcomed them for the event.

Coolie trailer: Rajinikanth, Aamir Khan, Nagarjuna go all guns blazingThe trailer for 'Coolie', featuring superstar Rajinikanth, was unveiled in Chennai on Saturday. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, the film revolves around a gold smuggler. The highly anticipated film will release on August 14 and clash with 'War 2' at the box office.

Vaibhavi Merchant wins National Award, says Dhindora Baje Re was always specialChoreographer Vaibhavi Merchant said the song 'Dhindora Baje Re' from 'Rocky Aur Rani Kii Prem Kahaani' was always special. She further expressed that winning the National Award for the song's choreography has infused a lot of life back into her work.

Same same but different: How Rajinikanth's Coolie poster sparks plagiarism buzzSocial media users have compared 'Coolie' posters to Hollywood films like 'Madame Web' and 'Glass'. The Rajinikanth-starrer is set for release on August 14, with its trailer launching today in Chennai.

Abhishek Banerjee, Aparshakti, and Varun Sharma unite for Imtiaz Ali's Side HeroesA new film, 'Side Heroes', featuring actors Abhishek Banerjee, Aparshakti Khurana, and Varun Sharma, has been announced. The film is expected to release on Friendship Day 2026 and is backed by filmmaker Imtiaz Ali.

Watch film first: Kerala Story director on Pinarayi Vijayan's National Award criticism'The Kerala Story' director Sudipto Sen slammed Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's remarks on the movie's National Award win, urging him to watch the film before passing judgment.

The real meaning of Shah Rukh Khan's National Award-winning speechFrom defending his reel son in 'Jawan' to standing tall for his real one, Shah Rukh Khan's National Award speech was more than gratitude. It was a statement. It was also a reminder that the King never left the throne - National Award or not.

Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot Ep 4: A new sanskaari Tulsi enters the show Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi reboot Episode 4: As Tulsi holds on to her ideals and the Tulsi plant in the middle of a storm, a new chapter begins - one that questions blood ties, justice, and what truly makes a mother.

The Holiday director Nancy Meyers surprised by reports of limited series: News to me'The Holiday' director Nancy Meyers expressed surprise at reports of the romantic movie being reimagined for a limited series on Apple TV+. She said the development is news to her as well. The original film stars actors Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jude Law and Jack Black in key roles.

Aadujeevitham: How the real Kerala story got snubbed at the National AwardsPrithviraj Sukumaran and director Blessy's 'Aadujeevitham' aka 'The Goat Life' got snubbed at the National Film Awards, which were announced on August 1 in New Delhi. Many fans pointed out that it was a gross misjudgement by the jury.

Atlee, Kamal Haasan, and Mohanlal congratulate SRK and other National Award winnersSouth Indian celebrities, including Atlee, Kamal Haasan, and Mohanlal, shared congratulatory messages to national award winners. Atlee, who directed Shah Rukh Khan's award-winning performance in 'Jawan', thanked the actor for giving him the opportunity to direct him.
Kishore Kumar: The Voice of Melody and MoneyFrom serving as the nation's payday anthem to his eccentric financial dealings, Kishore Kumar's relationship with money was as legendary as his melodies.

Shah Rukh Khan recalls losing national award for Swades in old video. Watch videoAn old video of actor Shah Rukh Khan expressing that he should have won a national award for 'Swades' has surfaced online. Actor Saif Ali Khan won the award instead in 2004 for his performance in 'Hum Tum'.

What is in Raanjhanaa's new AI-altered climax? Viral video from theatreMore than a decade after its release, 'Raanjhanaa' returns to theatres - this time with a twist of fate and a second chance at love. But while fans cheer the AI-altered ending, its original creators call it a betrayal of art. Here's all about it.

general news.headline: 3 terrorists killed, soldier injured as Operation Akhal in J&K enters Day 3The encounter in the Akhal forest area of south Kashmir began on Friday when a joint team of the Jammu and Kashmir Police, Army and CRPF launched a cordon and search operation.

He has his reasons: Shashi Tharoor differs with Rahul Gandhi over Trump's remarkCongress MP Shashi Tharoor has differed with party leader Rahul Gandhi over the latter's support for US President Donald Trump's 'dead economy' remark.

Malegaon case a Congress conspiracy: Sadhvi Pragya gets rousing welcome in BhopalSadhvi Pragya Singh Thakur, a resident of Madhya Pradesh, received a warm welcome as she arrived in Bhopal for the first time after being acquitted in the Malegaon blasts case.

Odisha girl, set 'ablaze' days ago, dies in Delhi. Then a twist from copsWhile the girl's mother alleged that three individuals were involved in setting her 15-year-old daughter on fire, the Odisha Police said their investigation found no evidence of involvement by anyone else in the incident.

Can Indian bananas stop the invasion of colonial Cavendish?The British-origin Cavendish banana is invading markets across the world and has become the dominant variety sold everywhere. Even in India, Cavendish and its sub-varieties have gained territory, making native varieties like Bihar's Chinia and Assam's Bhimkol harder to spot. From Tamil Nadu to the Northeast, the native kadali phalams are putting up a tough fight. Will desi bananas be able to beat back the colonial Cavendish?

ENG vs IND, Day 4 weather: Will rain disrupt the Oval thriller?Day 4 at The Oval could shape the entire England vs India Test series, but with rain looming over London once again, fans and players alike are bracing for a weather-interrupted thriller.

Tejashwi Yadav claims his name missing from Bihar survey list, poll body countersRJD leader Tejashwi Yadav on Saturday alleged his name was missing from Bihar's revised draft voters' list, a claim the Election Commission promptly denied by sharing his electoral details.

Delhi-NCR wakes up to battering rain; waterlogging, flight delays reportedHeavy rain lashed New Delhi and adjoining areas on Sunday, causing severe waterlogging, disrupting road transport, affecting flight services.

ENG vs IND: Mohammed Siraj outsmarts Zak Crawley with clever setup before stumpsIndia fast bowler Mohammed Siraj outsmarted Zak Crawley with a clever setup just before stumps as he bluffed the England batter to destroy his stumps before the end of the day's play.
Flipkart Freedom Sale: Tablets Get Their Biggest Price Drop of the YearFor buyers looking to invest in a new device, this could be the best chance before the festive season arrives.

Akash Deep's flair, Washington's assault: India break England's spirit on Day 3India vs England 5th Test: India thoroughly dominated Day 3 of the final Test match. With the bat, the Indian tailenders put up an exceptional assault, and with the ball, Mohammed Siraj's wicket on the final ball of the day, left England reeling.

Money important than blood: Uddhav Sena MP slams government over Ind vs Pak matchPriyanka Chaturvedi accused the government and BCCI of prioritising monetary gains over national sentiment by allowing an India-Pakistan match.

Gauri Khan, Suhana celebrate SRK, Rani and Karan Johar's National Award winShah Rukh Khan won his first National Award for his performance in 'Jawan'. His wife, Gauri Khan and daughter Suhana celebrated SRK, Rani Mukerji and Karan Johar's win at the 71st National Film Awards.

Good step: Trump welcomes reports of India possibly halting Russian oil importsThe US has exerted geopolitical pressure on countries continuing to purchase Russian oil, as part of its intensified efforts to curb Moscow's revenue streams amid the ongoing war in Ukraine.

Why only someone very ignorant can think that Indian economy is deadIndia's strong GDP growth, low inflation, rising FDI, and sectoral reforms are cementing its rise as a resilient global economic leader amid global uncertainty.
Sanatana Dharma ruined India, not a religion: Sharad Pawar's NCP leaderJitendra Awhad said that people should not hesitate to call Sanatan Dharma and its ideology perverted.

Shubman Gill finishes England Test series with stunning 754 runs: Stat PackENG vs IND, 5th Test: Shubman Gill didn't have the best of times at The Oval, but overall, the newly-appointed Indian skipper had a spectacular time throughout the series.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

IndiGo bans man for slapping co-passenger mid-air, flyer who was hit goes missingIn an official statement, the airlines said that the assaulter has been suspended from flying on any IndiGo flights. Meanwhile, the man who was slapped has gone missing from Kolkata airport. He was scheduled to take a connecting flight to Silchar.

Rajinikanth roasts Coolie director, his self-deprecating jokes win hearts at eventSuperstar Rajinikanth is known for his public speaking skills. At the 'Coolie' audio launch, he made everyone laugh out loud while appreciating and complimenting the cast and crew of the film.

Video: Drunk man drives car onto railway station platform in Meerut, near trainAccording to officials, the man arrived at the station in an Alto car and drove it onto the platform while a train was present.

Raina lauds AB de Villiers for WCL final ton, says India would've crushed PakistanSuresh Raina heaped praise on AB de Villiers for his blistering hundred in the WCL final as South Africa crushed Pakistan on Saturday, August 2. Raina also said that had India played Pakistan, they would have crushed them too.

IIT Delhi convocation 2025 shows only 26% of 2,764 graduates are womenThe Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi held its 56th convocation on Saturday, awarding degrees to 2,764 students, including 530 PhD scholars and 43 international students. However, women comprised only 26% of the graduating class, with 735 female students receiving their degrees.

Prince Harry punched Prince Andrew over Meghan Markle remark, new book claimsPrince Harry denies claims from a new book alleging he punched Prince Andrew over Meghan's remarks, historian Andrew Lownie stands by his controversial source.

sports.headline: Watch: Sunil Gavaskar gifts Shubman Gill signed cap in special Oval gestureIndia legend Sunil Gavaskar gifted Shubman Gill a specially signed cap, offering his support and best wishes ahead of the crucial Day 4 at The Oval, where India aims to level the Test series against England.

Can India defend 374 at The Oval to avoid a series defeat? Here's what history saysENG vs IND, 5th Test: India have set England a formidable target of 374 to win at The Oval in London. However, England have successfully chased down large targets against India in the past, which should give them some confidence.

66 no less than a century: When batter Akash Deep thrilled Gill, teammatesShubman Gill, KL Rahul and the rest of the Indian team were left in awe of the special innings by pacer Akash Deep on Day 3 of the Oval Test. Akash scored his maiden fifty as India put up a target of 374 for England.

ENG vs IND, Day 4 weather: Will rain disrupt the Oval thriller?Day 4 at The Oval could shape the entire England vs India Test series, but with rain looming over London once again, fans and players alike are bracing for a weather-interrupted thriller.

Raina also said that had India played Pakistan, they would have crushed them too.

England pretty chilled about chasing down 374 in Oval Test: Josh TongueJosh Tongue has said that England aren't overthinking about the chase in the Oval Test and backed the batters to get the job done to seal the series. England need 374 runs to win the match.

3809 runs in 5 matches: Shubman Gill's India set new records in Oval TestENG vs IND: The Shubman Gill-led India are yet to save the series against England with two days left in the Oval Test, but they have shattered quite a few records during the game.

How Rohit Sharma's message fueled Yashasvi Jaiswal's Oval Test centuryStar India batter Yashasvi Jaiswal revealed that he got a message from former Test captain Rohit Sharma during his splendid century on Day 3 of the fifth Test against England at the Oval.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
